alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 10:12AM CST until March 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Approaching The Area... .A winter storm is still on track to bring snow to the area, with moderate to heavy snowfall already impacting roadways across central Iowa. Snow will continue to move into the area through the afternoon and evening, eventually tapering off through the overnight hours. Snowfall totals are expected to range from 4 to 7 inches, with some locally higher amounts possible. Snowfall rates approaching an inch per hour are possible this afternoon and evening across northeast Iowa into southwest and central Wisconsin. Rates this high will cause rapidly decreasing visibilities and quick accumulations, with roads quickly becoming snow covered and dangerous travel conditions developing. Consider altering travel plans if necessary. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Clark County. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 6 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
